result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution in an amount to be determined within 60 days

Pay 10% restitution surcharge

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Obtain and maintain full-time employment or undergo a course of education that equals 40 hours per week - PO can add community service hours if the def is not employed or in school 40 hours per week
.

Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Complete mental health programming and take all prescribed medications as directed
.

No Contact with Lori P unless she consents

No Contact with Jeff P. unless requested by the P's

No Contact with the P's residence unless authorized by the PO
.

GPS Monitoring with exclusion zone for the No Contacts with Justice Support Services is required

Complete any other assessments or other conditions required by the PO

Provide DNA sample

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 83 days if probation is ever revoked

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
Can be served on Electronic Monitoring with House Arrest through Justice Support Services - def can only be out for education, employment and medical and health appointments

No sentence credit toward jail time
.

superMiscConds.notes:
Def to undergo Alcohol and Drug Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommendations.
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random screenings.

No contact with any known drug users/dealers.

No locations where drugs are used/sold.

No contact with L.P left up to PO.
.

Make payments toward any outstanding financial obligations.

  Pay DOC Supervision fees.

  Undergo any other assessments or evaluations deemed appropriate by PO regarding mental health & controlled substances and follow through with any treatment recommendations.

supervisions.notes: Financial obligation owed is to be paid from all funds received into defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy.

Court: EM was suspended, when is the release date?
Atty Davis - 12-15-15 - renew request for release to EM
Court: Makes comments
RELEASE DEF TO JSS GPS WITH THE SAME TERMS
AND CONDITIONS PREVIOUSLY IN EFFECT.
JS Sentence Violation - Per RAG:  Hrg is set for 10-30-15 to address violations

3:06 pm Def in court w/ Atty Meredith Davis.  Def in custody.  John William Kellis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Davis:  This is a probation review hrg.  The big question is how jail programming would go.  He has a place to go if released.  Court:  Has the agent been given notice of this?  Davis:  Yes.  I thought she would be here today.  Court:  What is the Dept.'s position?  What is their number?  Court calls Dana Albitz at the DOC but gets Mark Frise.  Frise:  Per Albitz's notes, he's not participating in programming in the jail because he was in lock down for 5 days.  He's charged with deliver of heroin so I know the Dept. wouldn't agree with that type of request.  Davis states there's a plea in the heroin case on Nov 17th...  He was placed on probation in Aug.  He'll get back into his programming.
COURT comments.  I'm not going to rule out em prior to the release date in mid- Dec.  However, I want to see you progressing more in the jail program before thats considered.
REV HRG:  11/20 at 2:30 pm    SLH
signed SLH

Request for Modification or Change in Sentence filed
SLH: PO for comment on furlough
PO Albitz: do not believe releasing from jail would be in his great interest at this time
SLH: denied
Meredith Davis
